list_definition.definition: something that draws together and holds tightly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The dentist fitted her with a brace to straighten her teeth.

list_definition.definition: to make (often oneself) firm or steady

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He braced himself for the struggle.

list_ex_of_english: Dentist who puts on braces, straightens teeth.

We are entitled to know as soon as possible how long the "belt and braces" method will be continued.
I would ask him to carry out very careful experiments before he does away entirely with those bracing wires.
Perhaps the council did over-design the wall and go for a belt and braces solution.
We feel that this type of prescription should have been protected from the bracing winds of the market.
There has been some regrettable delay in obtaining spinal braces of good quality.
In effect, it is a belt and braces provision as it is a second statement of the same provision.
